results.title: It's easier in the country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
One of a series of films which looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Investigates the idea that the country is the best place to rear children by looking at the lives of two boys from different country backgrounds.

results.title: It's different today
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description: This is a general recruiting film for the Royal Australina Navy. A young seaman waiting to join his ship is regaled by an old sailor with a discussion on ‘how things used to be when I was young’ intercut with action shots of navy manouvres and training exercises.

results.title: It's all man-made
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, James Archibald, Central Office of Information and Department of Environment
results.brief_description: Traces the impact of man’s industrial pursuits on the environment, focusing on the United Kingdom, and how industrialisation can work side-by-side with improving the natural landscape. Commentary by Ian Morrison.

results.title: It's about time
results.creator_credit: Danny Carter and British Information Services
results.brief_description: This film presents some extravagant or unusually designed historic time-pieces. Captures the ingenuity of horologists and craftsmen seen at work in a large factory producing clocks and watches on a mass production line. Commentary by Frank Hawkins.

results.title: It's a small world
results.creator_credit: Brian Smith, Lewis Gilbert and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Life in a typical nursery school in Britain, capturing their involvement in games, painting, modelling, climbing and acting and ending with a birthday tea party and a dip in a pool. Traditional gender roles can be observed as the girls cook in the kitchen, while the boys occupy themselves with building. A non-narrated film with musical accompaniment.

results.title: It's a new world!
results.creator_credit: Amateur Swimming Association and Venture Film Services
results.brief_description: Shows the advantages of swimming for the physically disabled, focusing extensively on the methods of holding handicapped children in water to build water-confidence and compensate for the lack of movement on land. Looks at ways children with disabilities have overcome their handicaps and some of the achievements of the disabled in their sport.

results.title: It's a dangerous world
results.brief_description: An informational film promoting the benefits of undertaking a first aid course by alerting viewers to a myriad of domestic hazards. Shows the attitude of an ordinary person to accidents in all fields. The extent of deaths and injuries from accidents; how various types of accidents happen.

results.title: It's a crime
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An animated film, in a humorous vein, showing how seasonal unemployment may be greatly lessened if industry, and the public generally, avail themselves of the increased labor supply during winter lay-offs. The advice comes from someone who knows—a gentleman thief and safecracker whose nefarious but highly skilled profession gives him a particular advantage in assessing the state of business, and the contents of strong boxes, during the winter fall-off of work. How the situation may be rectified with a little foresight and imagination is amply and amusingly illustrated. Animation by Gerald Potterton and commentary by Guy Glover.

results.title: It'll be alright on the night. 3
results.creator_credit: Paul Smith and London Weekend Television
results.brief_description: Written and presented by English comedian, Denis Norden, this program features as part of a television series on British television. Shows a collection of bloopers and stuff-ups in the film and television industry in Great Britain and America from feature films to commercials to soap-operas to current affairs programs.
